tuv.seg: • Appealing Court of Appeal decisions
• Cinntí na Cúirte Achomhairc a achomharc
The Court of Appeal was established on 28 October 2014 under the Court of Appeal Act 2014
Bunaíodh an Chúirt Achomhairc an 28 Deireadh Fómhair 2014 faoin Acht um an gCúirt Achomhairc, 2014
Its main function is to hear appeals from the High Court and the Circuit Court
Is é a príomhfheidhm éisteacht le hachomhairc ón Ard-Chúirt agus ón gCúirt Chuarda
It took over the role of the Court of Criminal Appeal and the Courts-Martial Appeal Court which were abolished
Ghlac sí ceannas ar ról na Cúirte Achomhairc Choiriúil agus Chúirt Achomhairc na nArmchúirteanna ar cuireadh deireadh leo
The only appeals that go to the Supreme Court are those which raise issues of major public importance or where the interests of justice require such an appeal

Is iad an t-aon achomhairc a ghabhann a fhad leis an gCúirt Uachtarach iad siúd ina dtugtar saincheisteanna lena mbaineann tábhacht mhór phoiblí chun solais nó ina dteastaíonn an t-achomharc sin ar mhaithe leis an gceartas
The Court of Appeal has a President and up to 9 judges
Tá Uachtarán agus a mhéid le 9 mbreitheamh sa Chúirt Achomhairc
The Chief Justice and the President of the High Court are additional judges
Breithiúna breise iad Príomh-Bhreitheamh agus Uachtarán na hArd-Chúirte
The President of the Appeal Court is an additional judge of the Supreme Court and of the High Court
Breitheamh breise den Chúirt Uachtarach agus den Ard-Chúirt is ea Uachtarán na Cúirte Achomhairc
The President distributes and allocates the work of the Court of Appeal
Déanann an tUachtarán obair na Cúirte Achomhairc a scaipeadh agus a leithdháileadh
Matters coming before it are normally heard and determined by 3 judges
Is gnách go n-éisteann 3 bhreitheamh le saincheisteanna a thagann os comhair na cúirte anuas ar chinneadh a dhéanamh orthu
However, some interlocutory and procedural applications may be heard by the President or another nominated judge alone
D’fhéadfadh an tUachtarán nó breitheamh eile a ainmnítear éisteacht le roinnt iarratais idirbhreitheacha agus nós imeachta ar bhonn aonair, áfach
An interlocutory application is an application for a temporary decision to deal with issues that will be finally decided when the case is fully heard
Is ionann iarratas idirbhreitheach agus iarratas ar chinneadh sealadach chun déileáil le saincheisteanna a ndéanfar cinneadh orthu ar deireadh nuair a éisteadh leis an gcás ina iomláine
Procedural applications could include, for example, an application for legal aid
I measc na n-iarratas nós imeachta, mar shampla, d’fhéadfaí iarratas ar chúnamh dlíthiúil a áireamh
The Court of Appeal is not a court of local or limited jurisdiction
Ní cúirt dlínse áitiúil nó dlínse teoranta an Chúirt Achomhairc
The Court of Appeal has jurisdiction in civil proceedings:
Tá dlínse ag an gCúirt Achomhairc in imeachtaí sibhialta:
• It can hear appeals from decisions of the High Court except for those cases where the Supreme Court has permitted an appeal to it
• Is féidir leis an gCúirt éisteacht le hachomhairc ó chinntí na hArd-Chúirte seachas i dtaobh na gcásanna siúd inar cheadaigh an Chúirt Uachtarach achomharc a dhéanamh léi
• It may give a ruling on a question of law submitted to it by the Circuit Court
• Féadfaidh sí rialáil a thabhairt ar cheist dlí a gcuireann an Chúirt Chuarda faoina bráid
• It can hear appeals from cases heard in the High Court about whether or not a law is constitutional
• Féadfaidh sí éisteacht le hachomhairc ó chásanna ar éisteadh leo san Ard-Chúirt faoi cé acu an bhfuil nó nach bhfuil dlí bunreachtúil
The Court of Appeal hears appeals against convictions or sentences given by the Circuit Criminal Court, the Central Criminal Court (High Court) and the Special Criminal Court

Éisteann an Chúirt Achomhairc le hachomhairc i gcoinne ciontuithe nó pianbhreitheanna a thugann an Chúirt Choiriúil Chuarda, an Phríomh-Chúirt Chuarda (an Ard-Chúirt) agus an Chúirt Choiriúil Speisialta
The Director of Public Prosecutions can appeal to the Court of Appeal:
Féadfaidh an Stiúrthóir Ionchúiseamh Poiblí achomharc a dhéanamh leis an gCúirt Achomhairc:
• A decision not to order a retrial
• Cinneadh gan atriail a ordú
The Director of Public Prosecutions can also appeal a point of law from a trial on indictment to the Court of Appeal
Chomh maith leis sin, féadfaidh an Stiúrthóir Ionchúiseamh Poiblí achomharc a dhéanamh ar phointe dlí ó thriail ar díothú leis an gCúirt Achomhairc
This does not mean that the Court may overturn the verdict of "not guilty"
Ní chiallaíonn seo gur féidir leis an gCúirt fíorasc “neamhchiontach” a chur ar ceal
It simply clarifies the law for future cases
Ní dhéanann sé ach an dlí a shoiléiriú ar mhaithe le cásanna amach anseo
Although criminal cases are heard and determined by 3 judges, the Court of Appeal gives one judgment unless there is a constitutional issue involved
Cé go n-éisteann 3 bhreitheamh le cásanna coiriúla, tugann an Chúirt Achomhairc breithiúnas amháin mura bhfuil saincheist bhunreachtúil i gceist
The existence of a dissenting opinion is not made public
Ní dhéantar tuairim phoiblí de más ann do thuairim easaontach
Courts-Martial are military courts
Cúirteanna míleata iad na hArmchúirteanna
They deal with offences against military law by members of the Defence Forces
Déileálann siad le cionta i gcoinne an dlí mhíleata ag comhaltaí na bhFórsaí Cosanta
The Court of Appeal hears appeals from people who had been convicted by a Court-Martial
Éisteann an Chúirt Achomhairc le hachomhairc ó dhaoine a ndearna Armchúirt iad a chiontú
Information on the court-martial system is available at military.ie
Tá fáil ar fhaisnéis ar chóras na n-armchúirteanna ag military.ie
Appealing Court of Appeal decisions
Cinntí na Cúirte Achomhairc a achomharc
Decisions of the Court of Appeal can only be appealed to the Supreme Court:
Ní féidir cinntí na Cúirte Achomhairc a achomharc ach leis an gCúirt Uachtarach:
• If the decision involves a matter of general public importance, or
• Má bhaineann ceist lena mbaineann tábhacht ghinearálta phoiblí leis an gcinneadh, nó
• If, in the interests of justice, it is necessary that there be an appeal
• Más gá, ar mhaithe le ceartas, go ndéantar achomharc
You can find further information on the Court of Appeal on the Courts Service website
Tá fáil ar bhreis faisnéise ar an gCúirt Achomhairc ar láithreán gréasáin na Seirbhíse Cúirteanna
